conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
The image shows three openings labeled A, B, and C at the top, with baffles of various colors guiding the liquid's path. At the bottom, there are two containers labeled D (red) and E (green).
Liquid released at A will be guided left by the first baffle it meets.
Liquid released at A will then be successively steered toward the left-most collection chute.
Liquid released at A ends in container E.
Liquid released at B travels mostly down the center.
Liquid released at B undergoes a series of deflections.
Liquid released at B is guided to the red central chute.
Liquid released at B ends up in container D.
Liquid released at C starts right of center.
Liquid released at C is shunted rightward by the baffles.
Liquid released at C bypasses the central red chute.
Liquid released at C pours into the next chute to the right, which is container E's neighbor.
Liquid released at C ends in container E.
Final answers: A → E, B → D, C → E.
